USGS Water Data for the Nation Help System http://help.waterdata.usgs.gov These are the search results for the query, showing results 1 to 2. What does the USGS parameter 00000 mean? http://help.waterdata.usgs.gov/faq/about-usgs-parameters/what-does-the-usgs-parameter-00000-mean \ufffd\ufffd

The parameter code 00000 identifies records where no measurement was taken, but the site was visited. Many of these types of records are associated with a visit to a groundwater site. Often a measurement cannot be taken if the well is dry, but the information on the status of well is important and does indicate a condition of the water level. For a case where the well is dry, the information indicates a minimum depth to water that corresponds to the depth the well bore. There are a number of conditions where a measurement can not be taken but the status provides other important information. Since no measurement is taken, the value in the record can not be assigned a parameter code. The code 00000 was assigned for such records in the groundwater levels web service.

\ufffd\ufffd

\ufffd\ufffd

]]> No publisher Mark Hamill parameters historical data groundwater discrete data 2013-03-21T13:28:19Z Page How do I access historical water-quality data? http://help.waterdata.usgs.gov/tutorials/water-quality-data/how-do-i-access-historical-water-quality-data How at search for discrete water-quality data

Start at http://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis (this link opens in a new window).

Step 1

Click on the blue Water quality button.

Step 2

Click on the blue Field/lab samples button.

Step 3

Search for sites with water-quality data that meet particular criteria.\ufffd\ufffd In this example, "Site type", "Period of record", and "Sample medium\ufffd\ufffdtype" are selected.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Click submit.

Step 4

Select the specific attributes for your retrieval.\ufffd\ufffd In this example, all lake sites with samples collected in 2010 for bottom material will be retrieved.

Step 5

Scroll down and choose how you would like to see the list of sites that meet\ufffd\ufffdyour criteria.\ufffd\ufffdIn this example, a table of sites was selected, sorted by Site Number.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Click Submit.

Step 6

Review the list of sites found.\ufffd\ufffdIf you are satisfied with the retrieval criteria you selected\ufffd\ufffdand are ready to view or retrieve the water-quality data for ALL sites you your list, use the browser "Back" button to return to the previous page.\ufffd\ufffd Your previous selection criteria from Step 4 will still be listed.

Scroll down to the "Retrieve Water-Quality Samples for Selected Sites" section.\ufffd\ufffd Select the type of output desired.

Hint: Click on the button for\ufffd\ufffdhelp with any option.

In the example below, a table of data listing expanded attributes was selected.

Click Submit.

Step 7

Your retrieval will be displayed in the window or saved to a file, depending on the choices you made.\ufffd\ufffd Congratulations!

]]> No publisher Mark Hamill discrete data water quality 2011-10-26T14:55:00Z Page
